DOC.brief_summary: The study observational non-randomised control study compare visual acuity implantation POD 26 % FINEVISION TORIC respect POD 26 % TORIC
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Viusal Outcomes After Implantation POD 26 % FineVision Toric ( PhysIOL ) POD 26 % Toric ( PhysIOL )
DOC.detailed_description: The study observational non-randomised control study compare visual acuity implantation POD 26 % FINEVISION TORIC respect POD 26 % TORIC This study include eye 24 patient implanted POD 26 % FineVision Toric ( group 1 : 12 patient ) POD 26 % Toric ( group 2 : 12 patient ) . The study primary goal compare near visual acuity group . Distance intermediate visual acuity , defocus curve , refraction straylight compare .
DOC.criteria: Patient old 50 year old Regular corneal astigmatism > 1.0 dioptre IOL Master ( regularity determine topography keratometry ) . Regular corneal astigmatism < 2.5 dioptre IOL Master ( regularity determine topography keratometry ) . Group 1 : patient cataract surgery Fine Vision toric implant eye Group 2 : patient cataract surgery Ankoris implant eye Availability , willingness sufficient cognitive awareness comply examination procedure • Irregular astigmatism Difficulty cooperation ( distance home , general health condition ) Acute chronic disease illness would increase risk confound study result ( e.g . diabetes mellitus ( retinopathy ) , immunocompromised , glaucoma etc… ) Any ocular comorbidity History ocular trauma prior ocular surgery include refractive procedure Capsule zonular abnormality may affect postoperative centration tilt lens ( e.g . pseudoexfoliation syndrome , chronic Uveitis , Marfan 's syndrome ) Pupil abnormalitis ( nonreactive , tonic pupil , abnormally shape pupil pupil dilate mesopic/scotopic condition ) IOL spherical equivalent power lower 10 D great 30D Complicated surgery
